intro: Rutidea melanophylla, commonly known as the black-leaved legume, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive dark green to black foliage. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow or white in color. Its unique leaf structure, with compound leaves and small stipules, contributes to its adaptability in harsh environments. Rutidea melanophylla is often found in rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions.
